perturbation.original_text: The COMPANY agrees to a one year engagement to contract the CELEBRITY to speak at the company meetings and seminars along with endorsement of the Company products.
perturbation.changed_text: The Right Solution agrees to a one year agreement to allow the CELEBRITY to speak at the company meetings and seminars along with promotion of the Company products.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'engagement' is replaced with 'agreement,' and 'endorsement' is replaced with 'promotion.' While seemingly similar, 'engagement' in the original context implied an active obligation, whereas 'agreement' is more passive. 'Endorsement' suggests a formal approval, while 'promotion' could be interpreted as simply mentioning the product. This creates ambiguity about the CELEBRITY's required level of support.

perturbation.explanation: Replaced 'independent contractor' with 'service provider,' 'Agreement' with 'Contract,' 'taxes' were softened to 'some taxes,' 'Distributor's Personnel' to 'Subcontractor's Employees,' 'business license fees' to 'business permits, if relevant', 'relationship of principal and agent, or employee and employer' with 'relationship of principal and representative, or worker and business owner'. These changes soften and weaken the definition of the CELEBRITY's role, potentially blurring the lines between an independent contractor and a representative of the COMPANY. This has tax implications as well as implications regarding authority to bind the company to other contracts.

perturbation.original_text: Subject to the provisions herein, the COMPANY and CELEBRITY agree to indemnify, defend and hold each other harmless from and against all demands, claims, actions, losses, damages, liabilities, costs and expenses, including without limitation, interest, penalties and attorneys' fees and expenses asserted against or imposed or incurred by either party by reason of or resulting from any action or a breach of any representation, warranty, covenant, condition, or agreement of the other party to this Agreement. The CELEBRITY will have full release of liability in regards to product performance and/or law suites resulting from use of the product. This liability will remain the responsibility of the COMPANY and manufacturers.
perturbation.changed_text: Subject to the clauses herein, The Right Solution and Bruce Jenner consent to protect, maintain and safeguard each other from any demands, allegations, acts, damages, debts, costs and outlays, encompassing, but not limited to, interest, fines and lawyers' costs and expenditures brought against or placed on either side because of any act or a violation of any statement, guarantee, pledge, term, or deal of the other signatory to this Contract. The CELEBRITY will have limited release of accountability in concerns to product operation and/or lawsuits emerging from utilization of the product. This accountability will potentially remain the responsibility of The Right Solution and factories.
perturbation.explanation: This replaces legal terms like 'indemnify, defend and hold harmless' with more general terms like 'protect, maintain and safeguard'. 'Claims' is replaced with 'allegations', 'Agreement' with 'Contract', 'full release' becomes 'limited release', 'liability will remain' becomes 'liability will potentially remain', 'manufacturers' to 'factories'. This diminishes the strength and clarity of the indemnification clause. By changing 'full release' to 'limited release', the extent of CELEBRITY's protection becomes vague. Adding "potentially" to “liability will remain” also reduces the clarity of who is responsible for product performance. Changing manufacturers to factories adds an ambiguity as well.
